content: Hello! I'm opening this topic to add a few words about me: I'm Oliver, Dataverse Core Team member and hacking on Dataverse since 2018. I'm working for https://www.fz-juelich.de library as an RSE. My second official hat when not hacking on Dataverse is currently https://software-metadata.pub.

Hi, my name is Phil and I'm also part of the core development team. My personal website is greptilian.com where you can find links to my IQSS page, GitHub profile, blog, etc. Ask me anything about Dataverse. :smile:

Hello, I'm Don. I'm an employee of the Odum Institute at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, and by extension a core team member of Dataverse. I've been involved with the project since mid-2015. I'm not really a tamagotchi, but Google let me choose one as my avatar.

Hi everyone, I'm Deirdre Kirmis and I manage our Dataverse installations at Arizona State University. We've had our production Dataverse up and running now for about 2 1/2 years, and our largest dataset is 17TB! We are running our installations on AWS so I've had a fun time learning about its different services to keep our site up and running! The folks here are truly awesome!

Hello! I'm Sherry Lake - Keeper of the UVa Dataverse. Our Dataverse has been running since March 2016. I have been to ALL of the Dataverse Community Meetings (including the last 3 online) and HOPE to go to this years meeting in Portugal. We will see.... my passport is being renewed.

Hello everyone! I'm Guillermo :wave:, I'm part of The Agile Monkeys and collaborate with the Dataverse Core Team. I've been mainly focused on the new SPA Frontend migration project, but I've also been involved in other topics like authentication and, more recently, containerization. GitHub profile.

Hi there, Slava here. Working with Dataverse starting from 2015 and never get tired. I did technical leadership of Dataverse platform development in EU Social Sciences and Humanities Open Science Cloud (SSHOC), contributed some stuff to previewers, external controlled vocabularies support, semantics/Linked Data, Docker/Kubernetes etc.

Hi all.
I'm Jo√£o Cardoso. Some of you met me during the DMC2023. I'm a data steward with the Portuguese national funding agency (FCT|FCCN). I'm one of the acting product owners of our Dataverse installation Polen Repository. I'm also one of main advocates for interoperability of our multiple services with machine-actionable data management plans. So If you ever feel like discussing that (or other topics) feel free to reach out.

Hello Dataverse community,
I am Julien from the French University of Lorraine.
https://dorel.univ-lorraine.fr/
I have just ‚Äúdiscovered‚Äù the possibilities of the Dataverse solution.
One of my first tasks is to plan with my colleagues the migration to a new French national installation from our current "local" installation in version 5.10.
We are working with Dimitri Szabo to make this migration to the French national Dataverse installation possible.
https://recherche.data.gouv.fr/en
I will probably come with a lot of questions about this. (API mostly)
Cu around to share and discuss,
Best regards
Bienvenue ;)

Hello everyone,
I'm Sakshi Jain. I'm an application developer with a focus on backend using Java and Spring boot.
I recently got introduced to the Dataverse repository because of Hacktoberfest. I recently raised a PR to fix an issue, looking forward to contributing more :)

Hello Everyone,

I‚Äôm Omer Fahim, and I‚Äôm excited to join you as the Senior QA and Production Support Manager for the Dataverse project. With a passion for quality assurance and a commitment to delivering exceptional user experiences, I bring 16 years of experience in managing QA processes and supporting production environments.

In my role, I‚Äôll be focusing on ensuring that our products not only meet but exceed the highest standards of quality. I believe that collaboration and open communication are key to our success, so I‚Äôm looking forward to working closely with each of you to tackle challenges, streamline processes, and drive innovation.

Let‚Äôs make this an incredible journey together!
Welcome, Omer!
Woohoo reinforcements have arrived! Glad you're here @Omer M Fahim :grinning:
With a bit of delay, welcome Omer ! :tada:

Hi,

I am Kai, a Web Developer and CS student at the University of Freiburg. I am currently working on my Bachelor Thesis, which is about integrating Dataverse into galaxyproject.org
@Kai K√∂nig that's awesome! Welcome! Please feel free to kick off a topic about the integration with Galaxy!

Philip Durbin üêâ schrieb:

Kai K√∂nig that's awesome! Welcome! Please feel free to kick off a topic about the integration with Galaxy!

Will do! In which channel would you create it? It would interesting to get some insights into the community, like the amount of people that are familiar with galaxy or even use it.
@Kai K√∂nig please post in #community. Thanks!
Thanks for posting #community > Dataverse-Galaxy Integration!

Hello Dataverse community!

I'm Charity Everett, a creative technologist and researcher specializing in XR data visualization. I'm excited to join this group and contribute to the evolution of Dataverse.My background includes fellowships at MIT's Open Documentary Lab and Harvard's Derek Bok Center for Teaching and Learning, where I've explored innovative ways to present complex data through immersive technologies.

I'm particularly interested in how we can leverage WebXR to enhance data exploration and analysis within Dataverse, making datasets more intuitive and accessible across disciplines.I've recently launched a startup, DataversiveXR, where we're collaborating with subject matter experts to create immersive WebXR experiences for journalistic publications.

This work aligns closely with Dataverse's mission of making data more accessible and understandable. I'm eager to explore potential synergies between DataversiveXR (https://dataversivexr.com/) and the Dataverse community, and to contribute to building out an XR-enhanced Dataverse.

If you'd like to connect or collaborate, you can find me on GitHub (https://github.com/CharityEverett) and LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/charity-everett-3798852a4).

Looking forward to engaging with you all!
@Charity Everett welcome! Please let us know how we can help! Please feel free to kick off a thread in #community about whatever is on your mind!
Thank you @Philip Durbin üöÄ for the warm welcome! I'll start that thread. :working_on_it:
Thanks for posting #community > Inquiry About WebXR Visualization for Dataverse!

Hi, I'm new here trying to learn about this amazing project, because a very good friend who is into Education in Arts and Culture ask me if I can help him to setup a open data platform for researchers in that field.

So here I am learning and mounting demos in Microsoft Azure mainly, because that's the standard in his department.
@Andres Mauricio Heredia hi! Welcome! If you have any trouble installing Dataverse, please feel free to ask in #troubleshooting.
